name: NYDailyNews
text:
A special of unit of 24 police officers has been formed to sweep through nightclubs in Spain and urge fun-seeking partiers to physically distance and keep their faces covered.
https://t.co/32XyDZRCIT

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Twitter has entered early talks about a possible combination with TikTok.

Microsoft remains the front-runner to strike a deal with TikTok, but the much-smaller Twitter figures it might face lighter antitrust scrutiny than other buyers.
https://t.co/ZKlTZl3GAi

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Rollerskating and good times returned to Brooklyn as Tanya Dean welcomed a crowd to skate away the blues.

The participants all wore masks — but the pandemic was an afterthought as they skated near the Black Lives Matter mural at Marcy Ave. and Fulton St.
https://t.co/8tEkHvU4Qc

name: NYDailyNews
text:
BBC radio host Sideman quit after a broadcaster defended the use of the N-word in a news report.

“This is an error in judgment where I can’t just smile with you through the process and act like everything is OK," Sideman said.
https://t.co/HAExqW19d6

name: NYDailyNews
text:
One of Georgia’s largest school districts saw 100 COVID cases, and will now stay virtual ahead of school starting up again.

Prior to the announcement, the county intended to offer families a choice of virtual or in-person classes.
https://t.co/IB39FxIT6O

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Everett Fitzhugh, hired by Seattle Kraken, became the NHL’s first-ever Black full-time play-by-play broadcaster.

“To be named a part of the broadcast and content team for a brand-new NHL franchise is a dream come true,” Fitzhugh said.
https://t.co/QLRyAF6hxq

name: NYDailyNews
text:
Ukrainian oligarchs laundered money by buying up Midwest office buildings and factories.

The feds say the Ukrainian billionaires bought those properties with dirty money, stolen from Ukrainian PrivatBank, which they used to own.
https://t.co/rIIaom2ShR
